alert.note: Alert for Orange; Person (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 5:41PM EST until December 17 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Alamance, Orange and Person. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 540 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Burlington, Graham, Roxboro, Hillsborough, Carrboro, Mebane, Elon, Concord, Gibsonville, Haw River, Swepsonville, Alamance, Carr, Schley, Efland, Bushy Fork, and Union Ridge.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Slow down and use caution while driving to avoid hydroplaning. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
